metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6338 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The dissect_sip_common function in epan/dissectors/packet-sip.c in the SIP dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.11 and 1.10.x before 1.10.3 does not properly initialize a data structure, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.3-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.3-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.3-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.3-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.3-1
tshark - 1.10.3-1
wireshark - 1.10.3-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.3-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.3-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1').
